dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1786 IH: James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York (for herself, Mr. Nadler, Mr. King of New York, Mr. Gibson, Mr. Tonko, Mr. Hanna, Mr. Katko, Ms. Slaughter, Mr. Higgins, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Pocan, Ms. Lofgren, Mr. Lance, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Rangel, Mr. Crowley, Mr. Serrano, Mr. Engel, Mrs. Lowey, Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. Vargas, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, Ms. Stefanik, Mr. Collins of New York, Mr. Larson of Connecticut, Mr. Courtney, Ms. DeLauro, Mr. Himes, Ms. Esty, Ms. Norton, Ms. Schakowsky, Mr. McGovern, Mr. MacArthur, Mr. Pallone, Mr. Sires, Mr. Pascrell, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Mr. Zeldin, Mr. Israel, Miss Rice of New York, Mr. Meeks, Ms. Meng, Ms. Velázquez, Mr. Jeffries, Mr. Cárdenas, Mr. LoBiondo, Mr. Lynch, Mr. Reed, Mr. Murphy of Florida, Mr. Payne, and Mrs. Capps) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committees on the Budget and the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To reauthorize the World Trade Center Health Program and the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund of 2001, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act.

section.header: Reauthorizing the World Trade Center Health Program

subsection.header: World Trade Center Health Program Fund
subsection.text: Section 3351 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300mm–61) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)—

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking each of fiscal years 2012 and all that follows through 2011) and inserting fiscal year 2015 and each subsequent fiscal year; and
by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: the Federal share, consisting of—

clause.text: for each subsequent fiscal year, the amount specified under this subparagraph for the previous fiscal year increased by the percentage increase in the medical care component of the consumer price index for all urban consumers as estimated by the Secretary for the 12-month period ending with March of the previous year; plus

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (4) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: Amounts that were deposited, or identified for deposit, for any fiscal year preceding fiscal year 2015, under paragraph (2)(A)(ii)(I), as such paragraph was in effect on the day before the date of enactment of the James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act, that were not expended in carrying out this title for any such fiscal year, shall remain deposited, or be deposited, as the case may be, into the Fund.

paragraph.header: Amounts to remain available until expended
paragraph.text: Amounts deposited into the Fund under this subsection shall remain available until expended.

in subsection (b)(1), by striking sections 3302(a) and all that follows through 3342 and inserting sections 3301(e), 3301(f), 3302(a), 3302(b), 3303, 3304, 3305(a)(1), 3305(a)(2), 3305(c), 3341, and 3342; and
in subsection (c)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(C), by striking consumer price index for all urban consumers (all items; United States city average) and inserting medical care component of the consumer price index for all urban consumers;
in paragraph (2)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking and at the end;

subclause.text: by striking for each subsequent fiscal year and inserting for each of fiscal years 2013 through 2014; and
by striking the period and inserting a semicolon; and

clause.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: for fiscal year 2015, $200,000; and

for each subsequent fiscal year, the amount specified under this paragraph for the previous fiscal year increased by the percentage increase in the consumer price index for all urban consumers (all items; United States city average) as estimated by the Secretary for the 12-month period ending with March of the previous year.
in paragraph (4)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking and at the end;

subclause.text: by striking for each subsequent fiscal year and inserting for each of fiscal years 2013 through 2016; and
by striking the period and inserting a semicolon; and

clause.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: for fiscal year 2017, $15,000,000; and

for each subsequent fiscal year, the amount specified under this paragraph for the previous fiscal year increased by the percentage increase in the consumer price index for all urban consumers (all items; United States city average) as estimated by the Secretary for the 12-month period ending with March of the previous year.

subsection.text: Section 3301 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300mm) is amended by adding at the end the following:
The WTC Program Administrator is authorized to promulgate such regulations as such Administrator determines necessary to administer this title.

subsection.header: Clinical centers of excellence and data centers
subsection.text: Section 3305 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300mm–4) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(B), by inserting and retention after outreach; and
in paragraph (2)(A)—

clause.text: in clause (i), by inserting before the semicolon , including data on the evaluation of any new WTC-related health conditions identified under section 3304(a); and
in clause (iii), by inserting and retention after outreach; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(1)(B)(vi), by striking section 3304(c) and inserting section 3304(d).

subsection.text: Section 3311(a)(4)(B)(i)(II) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300mm–21(a)(4)(B)(i)(II)) is amended by striking through the end of fiscal year 2020.
Section 3321(a)(3)(B)(i)(II) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300mm–31(a)(3)(B)(i)(II)) is amended by striking through the end of fiscal year 2020.
Section 3331(d)(1)(B) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300mm–41(d)(1)(B)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking in fiscal years 2012 through 2015 and inserting of each subsequent fiscal year; and
by striking and with respect to calendar quarters in fiscal year 2016 and all that follows and inserting a period.

subsection.text: Section 3342 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300mm–52) is amended by striking April 20, 2009 and inserting January 1, 2015.

section.header: Reauthorizing the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund of 2001

subsection.text: Section 403 of the Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting full before compensation; and
by inserting , or the rescue and recovery efforts during the immediate aftermath of such crashes before the period.

subsection.header: Timing requirements for filing a claim
subsection.text: Section 405 of the Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(3)(B)—

subparagraph.text: by striking during the period and inserting during an indefinite period;
by striking section 407(b) and inserting section 407(b)(1); and
by striking and ending on and all that follows and inserting a period; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(3)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(iii), by striking section 407(a) and inserting section 407(b)(1); and
in subparagraph (C)(ii)(II), by striking section 407(b) and inserting section 407(b)(1).

subsection.text: Section 406(d) of the Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)—

subparagraph.text: by striking section 407(b) and inserting section 407(b)(1); and
by striking $2,775,000,000 and inserting such sums as may be necessary to carry out this Act; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking shall ratably reduce the amount of compensation due claimants under this title in a manner and inserting may ratably reduce the amount of compensation due claimants under this title if necessary; and
in subparagraph (B)—

clause.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking on or after the first day and all that follows through the difference between and inserting the Special Master, when amounts are available, shall pay to the claimant the amount that is equal to the difference between;

subclause.text: by striking during such period; and
by striking applicable to such period and inserting applicable to the 5-year period described in such paragraph; and

clause.text: in clause (ii), by striking during such period.

subsection.text: Section 407(b) of the Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Not later than and inserting the following:

paragraph.header: James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Act of 2010
paragraph.text: Not later than
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act
paragraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of the James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act, the Special Master shall update the regulations promulgated under subsection (a) to the extent necessary to comply with the amendments made by such Act.

subsection.text: Section 255(g)(1)(B) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (2 U.S.C. 905(g)(1)(B)) is amended by—

paragraph.text: inserting after the item relating to Retirement Pay and Medical Benefits for Commissioned Officers, Public Health Service the following:

subparagraph.text: September 11th Victim Compensation Fund (15–0340–0–1–754).

paragraph.text: inserting after the item relating to the Voluntary Separation Incentive Fund the following:

subparagraph.text: World Trade Center Health Program Fund (75–0946–0–1–551).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to any sequestration order issued under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (2 U.S.C. 900 et seq.) on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
